subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4 ClasspathSuite
msgSnippet: Johannes, That s an excellent use of the RunWith extension hook.  It looks like it handles the problem floated in the thread called Dynamically discovering
messageBody:
Johannes,

That's an excellent use of the RunWith extension hook. It looks like
it handles the problem floated in the thread called "Dynamically
discovering classes in a package. (was: Re: [junit] Why is it
considered an error if there is no test in the file?)". Would you
agree that it does that? Thanks,

David

On 11/14/06, Johannes Link <john.link@...> wrote:
> For those wanting to run JUnit 4 tests across multiple projects in
> Eclipse I created a JUnit extension called ClasspathSuite
> (http://johanneslink.net/cpsuite.html). See my blog entry
> (http://jlink.blogger.de/stories/608077) about how it can be used.
>
> Johannes
>
>
